instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot
threads.message:
Hi guys! This is my first repair on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
Customer report no power after a small water spill near trackpad.
When I connect usb-c 61w power unit, fan starts and spin at lightspeed. Nothing else happens.
After checking power lines found that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> is missing (0,6v).
Found some corrosion under <CHIP>U8220</CHIP>, <SIGNAL>PM_EN_P3V3S0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_S0R</SIGNAL> are present and stable.
I've tried to clean/resolder <CHIP>U8220</CHIP> but no success, still 0,6v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>.
Can <CHIP>U8220</CHIP> be burned? it looks perfect... I should try to bypass it and inject 3v3 on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> and see what happens?
Thank you in advance. (y)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL>.
If not short, nor low value, then change <CHIP>U8220</CHIP>.

Fan spins high because of trackpad temp sensor issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot
threads.message:
Thank you man.
Diode mode with red probe to ground is 0.352
I'll try to change <CHIP>U8220</CHIP> and let you know.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot
threads.message:
Changed <CHIP>U8220</CHIP>, now everything looks great!
Machine is in perfect shape. Thank you again...
Now i have to deal with a newer <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> but i'll post a new thread for that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot
threads.message: You're welcome, glad to hear is solved...
